column4: My Linux experience is vast, I'm quite experienced in Debian releases.  However, I cannot figure out what the hell is going on here.  Someone tell me in the next two minutes what the hell is modifying my CPU speeds.  It is *NOT* bios, it is *NOT* powernowd.  Cpufreq is *not* installed.  It is *something else*.  What is it?  Failure to inform of what is modyfing my CPU speeds will not only see Ubuntu removed from this computer, but will
I have had some problems with that, and got it solved. COuld you specify more? Have you a laptop or desktop pc?
thank you for offering to help.  It is a desktop.

I have a laptop and my problem was that, with 6.2.20 kernel, it was always running at the maximum speed, so 'On demand' mode was not working. It was a bug, and in 6.2.22 it was solved. it was related with some specific models of laptops, including my sony vaio. But you use a desktop... don't know if this has something to do with your problem
